poem:
**In the Margin of a Suburban Sinkhole**

The earth gapes,  
hungry for stories,  
old bones of the past.  
Orange guardian teeters  
on the brink—watches us  
carry life's small motions.  
"I'll have to move out," Fran sighs,  
while Iain nods, unbothered—  
"No end of worlds today."  
No wheels, no rush,  
no road to retrace.  
Just silence, a gentle acceptance.
